Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rita B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights. Room was spotless and stylishly decorated- modern. Good bathroom. Decent sized room , lights with different settings- some reviews commented on the 'buzzing'- yes there was a slight noise but the different settings were excellent and we thought it was good fun. The staff were polite and friendly. We did not eat in the hotel. This hotel was good value for money and we would definitely stay at another in the chain or at this one again. One tiny gripe- the beds were two very large twins but this is something I have seen in several European hotels and the beds were larger than average.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: jenx2468
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci Arena in April 2012 for a 3 night break. The location of the hotel is very good for transport links, 5 minutes walk to both Metro and Aerobus. It is in a commercial district. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms we had were on the 5th floor overlooking the side of the hotel and road noise was almost non existant. The rooms we have were clean. The double beds were 2 singles bolted together. Room aircon & lighting were more than adequate. The bathrooms were clean and functional. Overall the accomodation had a boutique feel about it. Breakfasts and Wi-Fi were chargable extras. A very good breakfast food selection. We didn't try the restaurant at night. Overall a very good hotel for a short break in this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, not too sure about cleanliness though..”
Reviews.Author: kenji8888
Reviews.Content: Just as title said. The location is ok, we did have a "city view" lol not too sure the back streets of Barcelona is a decent city view though haha! Apart from being close to the airport and underground transport the cleanliness of the rooms have got to be questioned for. we found brownish/ red stains on one of the sheets and asked for an immediate change which was granted swiftly. I'm currently unsure whether to recommend a second stay next time I'm in Barcelona. But for the price we had paid for I can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great design”
Reviews.Author: stuDurham
Reviews.Content: Really good location near a major Plaza and within walking of Eixample Great architecture Breakfast boring but adequate

Reviews.Title: “Good location, limited facilities”
Reviews.Author: Beth P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location for touring Barcelona. Hotel staff were neither welcoming nor friendly. Hotel itself was nicely decorated, fair sized rooms. TV is pay per view except for news channel which is rather poor for a hotel of this standard,no tea and coffee making facilities. There was a hairdryer in the room, in the bathroom in a drawer. We didn't have food there as there are plenty of places locally, especially a lovely little bakery called Pauls which does lovely pastries. Fine as long as you don't intend to stay in the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Shoppinginheels
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a twin room at Vincci Arena for two nights recently. The pictures looked great and the hotel appeared to be in a central location. In reality, the room itself was quite small but considering it was only for sleeping and showering, I can't complain. The twin beds were pushed together to give the appearance of a double bed. The balcony is actually just a patio door that you open with a glass partition to stop you from falling onto the road below. The windows are not double glazed so you hear a lot of street noise and also from other guests walking down the corridors. The hotel is apparently a 4 star, but I would say it's more a 3 star trying to be a 4 star. In terms of location, it wasn't central for the majority of sights. However, it is a 5 min walk to the local metro station where in 10 mins you will be at La Rambla or Sagrada Familia depending on which line you take. My biggest dislike is that wifi is not complimentary and outrageously expensive. Other 4 star hotels I have stayed at offer this as complimentary so I was disappointed. The channels offered on the TV within your room were all in Spanish. The few TV channels in English were all news or constantly lost the signal. And the blockbuster movies they offered were 12.00 EUR which seems excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled like an ashtray”
Reviews.Author: WimGenesis
Reviews.Content: Allthough the location of the hotel is great and the design of the rooms beautiful quite some negative points for Vincci Arena. Note : I stay in some 50 hotels per year of all different types per year... 1. The room smelt like an ashtray. On arrival we did not notice because they had sprayed exaggerated quantities of some air freshener. Asking to change rooms it was not possible and ' just open the window a bit' ... So 2 days of nicotine smell was what we had to deal with. 2. The food in the restaurant was very good but make sure you have ample time to wait for service. About 30 minutes... The gentleman next to me was about to finish his beer and leave when finally his starter showed up. It was during the normal Spanish dining hours though. 3. The lighting control system creates such a buzzing sound it is better to switch it completely off when watching Tv or at night. Overall a disappointing experience in returning to this hotel. Last time for sure. I recommend you check tripadvisor for other better value places for your stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfactory, if a bit unexciting”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkArthur
Reviews.Content: We stay three nights in the Vincci Arena Hotel whilst on city break to Barcelona. The bedroom was very nice, clean, tidy and in good order. Beds were two singles pushed together which isn't to our taste but not a big problem. Breakfast is a buffet style meal and mostly the food is of a good quality and well presented. No idea how to make a good pot of English breakfast tea but that's what you expect in most American or continental hotels. The hotel is just a few hundred metres from Barcelona's very efficient and inexpensive metro system and it's on the route of the tourist buses as well. All in all it was perfectly satisfactory if somewhat unexciting. Very little sign of life in the lobby area. I wouldn't pick this hotel for a romantic trip abroad but if you are on business or want to spend your time in the city, then it's good. Our deal offered free wi-fi but this wasn't available (the mistake of the booking company, not the hotel) and there's a steep charge for wi-fi or you can connect for free in the bedroom using a cable supplied by reception. There is a spa but we didn't try this.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again if........”
Reviews.Author: Norm K
Reviews.Content: Would like to start off by saying I enjoyed my stay at the Arena. The hotel itself is decorated in a contemporary design and is very conventionally located close to the Plaza de Espanya (first stop on the airport bus) and metro stations. The front desk staff was wonderful and bent over backwards trying to listen to my attempts at speaking ‘Spanish’ (born and raised in Miami it’s a mixture of dialects). The floors and hallways are dark and warm (due to lighting arrangement), no ice available unless you walk down to the first floor and pray that someone is willing to walk back into the kitchen and “find” some ice for you. The beds are comfortable if you enjoy firm mattress, if you prefer something softer be ready for a so so night’s sleep! I have heard many Americans complain about the lack of AC while traveling around Europe, THIS WAS NOT THE CASE HERE!!!!! Room temperature was as cold or as warm as you could ever ask for. My only two truly negative remarks (i.e. concerns that need to be addressed before I return) one WiFi is not free (Someone please explain to the owners that free wiFi is now a more basic requirement as opposed to something paid for), and having someone manage the restaurant. For what they wanted to charge you for breakfast I expected a lot more (I eat lite breakfasts and still left hungry after paying 18Euro each). All in all my experience was very nice. I guess the restaurant I can do without, but will not be returning till such time as they ‘correct’ the free WiFi issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for personal trip stay”
Reviews.Author: gadol_travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the city center and close both to attractions and shopping area. The facilities in the hotel are standard but design is quite unique. The staff is responsive and English speaking. Would recommend this not expansive hotel for both business and private stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this hotel and would go back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: KentTospain
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, it's roughly 15 min from the city centre (La Ramblas) by metro and 2 min away from Espanya. Booked through laterooms.com and with our booking it included breakfast - prices very reasonable. Rooms very modern, nicely lit. Hotel very clean throughout. Well worth the money and would return. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and stylish”
Reviews.Author: hercoolgr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel a year ago. I'm a great fun of Vincci style since 2005, when I first visited the Vincci hotel in Madrid, but I was amazed by that hotel. Not only has the perfect location (it's just a walk away from two metro stations), but has a unique style (urban and minimal), so characteristic of the city. We stayed at a room on the last floor, which had a living room on the balcony, and an outdoor jakuzzi!! It was the perfect luxury, that got us spoiled (in the right way).

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikt150768
Reviews.Content: if you are planning to stay in barcelona you could not go wrong staying at this hotel, it is centrally located and within walking distance of the metro stops(less than 5 mins), the rooms are spacious the hotel is elegantly decorated and the staff are very helpful, this is a 4 star hotel and is ideal for couples who want a break in barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Modern - beds not very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Murnieks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Whilst I agree about the modern decor being dark and depressing who really cares when it's only really a problem in the corridors. + Everything was clean and relatively new + Bathrooms well equiped + Breakfast was good = Whilst the area is not the best in Barca it's within 5 mins walk of two metro lines which gets you to all the main tourist spots and 10mins walk from train station to the airport. Get a metro pass or 10 ticket pass as it will cover the whole lot nicely for the weekend at just €8. Bargain! - Bed was hard and not comfortable. Would I go back? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Depressingly dark decor and characterless”
Reviews.Author: JGNB
Reviews.Content: Check-in took much longer than it needed to as the gentleman at the desk broke off a couple of times to answer the phone and to attend to a courier who was dropping off some deliveries. The reception desk is not straight in front of you as you enter the hotel but is tucked away in a corner to the right. This, together with the dark decor and low lighting of the reception area and the lounge area, gives a rather unwelcoming first impression. The corridors leading to the rooms are extremely dark and, once again, the mood created is gloomy rather than welcoming. We would agree with some of the other comments about chipped surfaces in the bath and indeed some of the tiles on the walls around our bath were cracked but, overall, we found the room clean and well-maintained. The hotel is very handy to metro stations (just a short walk to Tarragona and Espanya metro stations). Start your journey from Tarragona, if you can, as it involves a lot less walking underground than if you use Espanya. There was some street noise, especially in the mornings, but a certain amount of street noise has to be expected in a city location. We didn't have lunch or dinner at the hotel, so can't comment on the quality of those meals. However, the breakfasts were excellent. Wireless internet access is extremely expensive. Considering it costs hotels relatively little to provide a wireless internet service, it always feels like a rip-off when they seek to charge you so much for it. The price we paid for the room was reasonable, considering the hotel's location, but our overall impression was that it lacked soul and character and came across as being rather gloomy.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it looks in photos”
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in this hotel mid October. We had 2 rooms. From the previous reviews and photos, it looks great, but to the eye it is not fantastic. Bathrooms had obviously had lots of leaks and poor repair work has been done. Mildew on tiles etc. The hotel was very uncomfortable because it was far too hot and there did not appear to be air conditioning in the public areas. Breakfast was fine. Location was good. 5 minute walk to underground station. On initial check in the receptionist was very unfriendly which created a bad impression from the start. I think we paid around £80 a night bed and breakfast per room. Cheap for Barcelona but would have to say, in my opinion, it is not worth any more.

Reviews.Title: “decor looks good in photos but poor workmanship ruined it.”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrs_10
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights coz wanted a botique style hotel. The hotel definitly looked good in photos, but when u arrived and see the actual thing, it all ruined-bathrom has mould at cornor sealent, tiles are unevenly aligned, uneven grouting(and even no grounting), white bathtube has a few permanent black mark and dirt that was washable, making you dont want to take a bath even there's a bathtube; shower has a power shower head, but the pressure just not enough. No air con in hotel lobby or corridor( may be it's just me, but doesn't feel too welcoming) Was there in October, mid week, hotel feels really empty. location was good, the arena shopping mall has good collection of shops/ restaurant and cafe, it is also the first stop of A1 airport bus, 5 minutes walk afte you get off.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: MarcosGoffredo
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Nice design, with an amazing room. Really good location, just a few steps from a Spanish Post Card. The rates are really cheap, considering the hotel quality.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel so cheap!? It was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Minerva22
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel because it was a short walk from Barcelona Sants station and because it was very easy on our budget. Little did we know it would be easy on our eyes and overall rest also. We walked down a dodgy alley way trying to find it and thought we were going to end up in the same sort of thing for the night, considering how cheap our nightly rate was. To or utter suprise and relief, we turned a corner and it was the corner! It was marvoulous, new and polished and welcoming, a lot fancier than we expected. It was air-conditioned the instant we stepped in, which was great as it was warm outside. We were quickly shown to our room even though we wer ein well before official check in time, and when we got in it was like we hit the jackpot. The room was stunning! Very modern and chic interior that was sp spacious and inviting that we tossed up whether to leave the room at all. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spacious with a lovely bath that I tested later, and the ameneties were great too. Overall, I had paid peanuts for what felt and looked like 5 star. The hotel is close to the main station, but not close to much else really. It meant we werent kept awake by traffic (soundproof glass ahoy!) and it meant that the hotel wasn't full of tourists with their kids. It was really peaceful and made for a great getaway on our Europe trip. Only downside was the retaurant staff, there was only 1 girl on when we went down and it took a very long time for her to realize we were there and serve us as I think she was also helping in the kitchen. Still worth it though as the meals were great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect rooms, Poor receptionists”
Reviews.Author: maria A
Reviews.Content: The rooms are romantic, the bath room is fantastic, hot bath and perfect shampoo and bath gel is provided.Tv is good but the wire less is so expensive 8 Euros per hour !!! the breakfast is also 12 for one and 18 for 2 ! the only disaster were the receptionists , they did not have the least information to offer the tourists. and we were tired of their poor English ! I don't know why the corridors were so hot like a Sauna but the room service was good and you can order pizza for your room! A cheap supermarket is located nextdoor for buying water or milk(cheaper than anywhere in Barcelona !)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and we will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: 232Claire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend just room only so breakfast wasn't included. The menu for food was very expensive so we didnt eat at the hotel which suited us as it was great to explore the area. But the staff were warm and friendly and you were always greeted on the way into the hotel which i thought was a nice touch. The decor is very modern and i think very tastefully done. The rooms were very clean and tidy. The only downside that we had 2 single beds pushed together instead of a double but to be honest it made a nice change to have so much room rather than being squashed! The location is great, there are lots of little cafe's and restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. There is a lovely tapas bar that is right next to the arena shopping centre ( i cant remember the name sorry but its very easy to find). It also right next to the magic fountain which is well worth a visit. Every night at 9pm the display starts. We had an amazing holiday lots of things to see and do and had a lovely base to come back to at night. NB: I would have thought there would be free WIFI but unfortunately this is not the case. Didn't spoil our holiday too much as the only thing we wanted the internet for was to find out about attractions and a map but there were leaflets on attractions and all of these provided a map so it wasn't too much of a problem. Also there was a internet cafe close by which provided an hour of internet access for about 2 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adele_Gr
Reviews.Content: Wonderful city! Perfect room, perfect service, and huge breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Clondyke
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the vincci arena. Would only rate this as a 3 star, not a 4 star. Advertises a bar facility, however this turned out to be only drinks fetched from the kitchen when ordered. Evening meal selection extremely poor - one tapas menu or pizza, or small selection of snacks - not what you expect for an evening menu from a 4 star hotel! Rooms were very dark, as were the corridors. Really wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money.”
Reviews.Author: alley089
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, the hotel was nice but wasnt very light in rooms needed the lights on at all times and the view wasnt great. Rooms are very clean, tv was awful for channels and cost to use everything else but the channels they provide. ordered breakfast both mornings found it hard to ask for what i wanted staff struggled to understand so it was a long proces to order food. some staff more friendley than others. hotel in good location never too busy and has everything you need near by. would recomend to anyone to get the hop on hop off bus that you can catch from 10 mins away if that from the hotel the bus takes u all around barcelona and you can get on and off as many times as you like, only cost 30 euros each for 2 days and is the safes way of geting around with out using the metro or buses. they have many stops and always warns you when one is coming up so easy to use, the tour itself is by voice that you listen to with head phones and you select your language its also a open top bus so you get great views. really enjoyed my trip and would go back to both hotel and place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, We loved it and we'll back”
Reviews.Author: dafna1
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter 4 nights. Modern hotel , Everything was excellent . very good breakfast, The room was big and clean .The staff were nice . very nice lobby . We'll return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Becky_Cliffe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for our honeymoon. It was clean and the staff were nice. It was far away from the action but luckily walking and taking transit ended up not being too bad. The shower leaked all over the bathroom floor and went into the hallway of our room. The staff cleaned it well and we figured out a way to stop the leaking from happening. Overall, it was okay but would try to stay closer to the downtown area when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: fanilli
Reviews.Content: It was clean and silent, bathroom was nice. Everything was ok, but nothing special but the price. This costed double than hostal I've been at, and the hostal was a lot better. Staff was indifferent, breakfast expensive and wi-fi ridiculously expensive. Oh, and minibar didn't work, fridge was warm. Location is good everywhere in Barcelona because metro and buses are good, cheap and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel near the Magic Fountain”
Reviews.Author: GTAlli
Reviews.Content: We booked the tripadvisor buy three nights, stay for four deal. It was a very clean, modern, large hotel room. The lobby and room were both very nice. The hotel is about a 7 minute walk from the metro station. The staff spoke English which was quite helpful. The internet is very expensive and therefore, we did not use it and there is no computer in the lobby. The area was a bit noisy at night, but that did not bother us much. If you are after a beach trip, this hotel is quite far from Barceloneta.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Clibs_30
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay at Vincci Arena. Room nice & kept very clean. Staff very nice & helpful. We were two female travellers, so wanted a place we would feel safe. This fits the bill. Only down sides are it is out of the way (Got round this using tour bus - That stops just down the road) And lack of resturants near by (Food in hotel was good). I would use this hotel again & tell friends to.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pete11419
Reviews.Content: Before we went read a few negative reviews. Do not know what peoiple expect from a City Center hotel, but this was a very good hotel. Ideally situated for all transport links, airport, train station and metros, only a couple of stops into main Barcelona area and marina. Staff freindly rooms good, a little small but for the time you spend in them they are fine. Had freinds who stayed in th executive siute, if you want large then go for this, also has roof terrace with sunbeds and jaccuzzi. Will be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Reception staff could try harder”
Reviews.Author: turkeyreview1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came for a wedding anniversary visit to Barcelona in mid May 2011. Reception staff were pretty indifferent. Our room was modern but dark and the furniture was a little scratched and worn - but room was quiet. The room was also a bit small. Expensive WiFi fees were an annoyance. Overall rating more like 3 star than a 4 star, however. Reception staff need to be trained in customer service - a friendly smile would be a good start....

Reviews.Title: “worth the grade of xxxx”
Reviews.Author: OdileW
Reviews.Content: modern hotel and near city centre , clean and staff friendly .

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay whilst on visit to Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: SmilerHove
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in a less touristy area in the Espana area. The location of the hotel is brilliant and it is really easy to get around places as the metro is a 5 minute walk. Also, the Arena is worth a vist for the fanstic views of the area/shopping and is a 5 minute walk from hotel. The hotel is very quiet and extremely clean. Our room was a great size for the two of us with a large bed (even though it was a little hard). The bathroom is a good size and the whole room is decorated in a trendy way. It can be a little nosy as the hotel is on the corner of two roads. The restaurant never looked busy so we went out for some lovely traditional Spanish food - definitely go for the tapas option with a cheeky cava (very cheap)!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, already recommended it to other friends”
Reviews.Author: jjng
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vincci Arena in Barcelona for three nights in September 2010. It was an absolute steal for what we paid (~$160/night) because we received a gorgeous suite on the top floor. The one issue for me was that it was difficult to find, being situated on a side street. We arrived late in Barcelona's airport and took the last train into the city. Although the hotel is very close to Barcelona Sants (main train station), we took the wrong exit and were further directed in the wrong direction by locals. This was clearly our fault for not being able to read our maps correctly, but Barcelona addresses can be deceiving (i.e. Commerc 24). The reception was a bit frosty, and I would not describe the concierge as friendly, but we were checked in quickly and also directed to a nearby convenience store since restaurants were closed by the time we arrived. The hotel is very trendy with dark decor. When we stepped into our suite, we were very impressed by the size, decor and vast array of amenities that were included. It had separate closets, a large bath, separate toilet "room", a chaise and desk, complicated lighting options ("mood" lighting from romantic to bright), a private balcony with a jacuzzi (which was unfortunately broken and only filled with cold water despite a call to fix it). We were so impressed that unfortunately I appear to have forgotten to take photos (usually the first thing I do after setting down any luggage). The hotel is not central to city sights, but within 10-minute walking distance to the nearest metro station, and also quite close to an indoor food market as well. For luxury at a great price, I would recommend this hotel, and already have to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed - Highly Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: alloverman
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights here in April, location was perfect for us as it was away from the hustle of Catalonia and so heading to Arena at night was a nice break. Plaça Espanya is a 5 minute walk and the train from there is only a few stops from where it all happens. This hotel is very trendy and boutique, rooms are on the small side but hey who goes to Spain to spend the day in their room ? The rooms where spotlessly clean, bathrooms where as new and couldn't ask for anymore for the money spent. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as there where so many coffee shops that you could stop at in the morning and experience the country your in. The only downside was no free wifi which only comes in handy when travelling.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best rooms I've slept in”
Reviews.Author: MassR
Reviews.Content: Vincci Arena is a very trendy hotel. The location is not the best one in Barcelona but is quite convenient as very close to Plaça Espanya where you can find buses, underground, train and taxis. We booked an executive room and we were not disappointed! The room was on the 7th (highest) floor and was just huge, clean and luxurious. The king size bed was perfect as well. But what was best is the large terrace with deck chairs, a very nice jaccuzzi (although not so easy to use) and a beautiful view on the Montjuic mountain.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, wifi not free”
Reviews.Author: angelo140884
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated conveniently 5 mins from underground, staff quite pleasant, rooms very nice and very clean, lobby very nice. WIFI and TV HOWEVER , COME AT A CHARGE! if room is above raod, you will hear a little bit of street life at night if you are a light sleeper

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gamzmasta
Reviews.Content: A nice stay, The annoying thing was the desk clerk always greet you when you leave and enter, near a tourist attraction and near shops and food all you need for a tourist

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and quite: close to Railway station”
Reviews.Author: Iflyer4
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased to stay in this hotel after noisy family hotels in Salou. Really nice: no kids, no fuss.. Stylish hotel for grownups. Fine linen, fine furniture (not brand new, but not spoilt), goof quality bath equipment.. Location is good - right next to Miro's Woman statue. Close to railway and Monjuik Perfect to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sbyyz77
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks excellent, is very conveniently located, has stores all around and very handy, but dissapoints on a few fronts. 1. No Wifi 2. For a 4 star hotel, they have one 1 staff or max 2 on duty at any one point in time. 3. No Iron to loan to guests 4. Very hot in the corridors Goods were the look of the hotel...very nice, nice fittings, good size rooms, and great location, close to the Aerobus and the metro. For the money paid, I would definitely have expected an iron to use before going to the airport!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: kayfont
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance of Plaza D'Espanya which is the first stop on the airport shuttle. You can walk to the main tourist area from there but I would recommend taking the metro to Catalunya which is a handy base. The hotel itself is stylish, nicely decorated and good value and I would definitely recommend it for business or leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Just the place for a short break”
Reviews.Author: jweaver
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as there was a really good deal as part of a package. We were not disappointed, in fact very pleasantly surprised. Room was a nice size, modern, comfortable and clean. AC in the room worked well and was vital given the time of year. Location really suited us as it was 5 mins from the Metro and all sites, including the football stadium, were within easy reach. Breakfast was a real plus and a big hit with my 18-year-old son. Staff and service were very good - we left our bags here for the day after checking out with any problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel. nice, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: CRock999
Reviews.Content: beds were a little hard, but everything else was excellent. Great location near market/metro

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Choice”
Reviews.Author: bmore5219
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Vincci Arena for six days. First of all, the location of the Hotel is pretty perfect. Not only are you only a five minute walk from one of the main train stations, Estacio de Sants, but you're also smack dab in the middle of a neighborhood so you're away from the hustle and bustle of Barri Gotic, yet, you're at most a 7-8 Euro taxi ride to about everything. Every morning we woke up and walked to a small cafe called Las Ramblas 31 and had a small breakfast which totaled about 8 Euro's for two people- tough to beat that. The rooms were nice. They were a decent size and we had no issue what so ever with noise. Also, the front desk was very helpful in answering any question we had. They only complaint I would have is that when we asked for ice for the room it took like 30 minutes for it to come to our room- a small inconvience. Like many other reviewers, if you plan on spending much of your time in the Barcelona and not the hotel, it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: tolba
Reviews.Content: A very good choice for the money we paid.Rooms a little bit small but beautiful, clean and with big bathroom.Very good location near metro (2 lines - one direct to center), near bus stop from airport (Aerobus) and next to major touristic attractions.Expensive breakfast that we didn't choose but nearby many alternatives (bakery shops).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Andara42
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and sits at a great central location in Barcelona. It is orented towards business travels but you don't feel weird when you are there for a holiday. The connection to the aiport is excellent (via the bus from Place de Espana) and there are two subway stations nearby. The rooms were very tidy, but noisy. The hotel is located at near amajor road and the windows are just not tight enough for my german understanding. We are a little picky about noise so this might not be an ssue for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice design and just good enough”
Reviews.Author: DiscoD27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It looks very funky and modern. Room was clean and a nice size. I wasn't in the room all that often so this place was perfect. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: victorlcb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vincci Arena at the end of March for 3 nights. We booked it via Splendia.com got a very good deal. Value wise this hotel is excellent, never stayed in a Vincci hotel, overall quite impressed. Room is modern, the lighting is good with different mood settings. Bed is just average, a double bed is made up of two singles. Lots of storage space, small TV. The bathroom is good but there are some unremovable stains in the bath tub. One shortcoming is that the wifi is not free in this hotel, which is kind of unusual this day and age. Didn't opt to pay for wifi, just went to Starbucks everyday to check emails. There is a very small gym (one treadmill and two cycling machines) in the basement, a sauna, a steam room and showers. All very clean and neat. And the staff was very accommodating, they switched the sauna on for us late in the night, much appreciated. Location is a bit far out, but Metro station (Tarragona) is only 3 minutes away. The line would take you to most places.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: beothuk7
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and good service, to the limited extent used. You may want to avoid exterior rooms on the c/de Bejar side. Neighborhood trash and recycle containers are emptied nightly around 3am with much fanfare. Had some rather fulsome neighbors from Germany with a snoot full whooping it up after Stuttgart's loss to Barca, but I suppose that falls within acceptable behavior.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in lovely quiet location”
Reviews.Author: LyndaCambridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my mum for a Mothers Day treat and the receptionist who was very courteous told me we were booked into one of the nicest rooms in the hotel. He wasn't wrong, it was lovely with a beautiful turquoise and gold colour scheme with a walk in wardrobe and separate bathroom and wet room. We even had our own balcony. The beds were nice and firm and outside was lovely and quiet. The hotel is a 2 minute walk away from Tarragona metro stop and the centre of Barcelona was a 10 min train ride away. We had breakfast at the hotel on one morning but it was €18 for 2 people and we didn't really feel it was worth it. If you walk out of the hotel and go right and down to the end of the street, there are several patisseries which sell huge pain au chocolats and other gorgeous pastries. I'm glad we stayed a bit out of the centre as around the La Rambla area, we saw several people who had been pickpocketed and it all seemed a bit too lively with a lot of hustle and bustle - a haven for thieves! The best buy is the Barcelona Turistic bus - we hopped on and off it for the whole weekend so got to see all of the sights - well worth £48 for the two of us. A lovely weekend on the whole!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the ligh and water show nearby”
Reviews.Author: raegan131313
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, spacious room, spacious bathroom, close to the met only a few stops away from the old quarter. Close to Parc Montjuic where the ligh and water show is. Attentive staff, very clean. Would stay again, though it great value. Though it one of the nicest hotels we stayed at in the 6 cities we visited in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy but disfunctional design”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelBerlin
Reviews.Content: This is a design hotel. But it looks good only on the surface. Effectively it is one of the most poorly designed hotel, as it is one of the most energy inefficient ones I have ever seen. The lights in the hallways are always on, and they are inefficient and producing more heat than light. They hallways are hot because of that, and you need more energy in air conditioners to cool them down. Rooms are small, but also there the refrigerator is placed in a closed box and trying desperately to cool while it can't vent the heat anywhere. In the bathroom many details witness of poor craftmanship.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms and service! Location was so-so.”
Reviews.Author: n00dles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights during our honeymoon. I can't speak to the value since we got to stay for free (we had our hotel reception at a Vincci hotel, and they have this awesome honeymoon-in-Spain perk). I believe we were given the Executive Room, which was so swanky and awesome. When you first walk into the room, you enter a short "hallway." To the left and right are the bathrooms with frosty sliding glass doors--one with a sink and bathtub/shower, and one with a sink, toilet and bidet. Super clean. Felt new, too. Two sliding doors open up to the bedroom area -- to the left, the bed and two chairs; to the right, ample closet space separated from the bed area by a desk. We're talking the entire wall was closet space. I loved our room. Since we were on our honeymoon, we didn't mind spending time just relaxing at the hotel and enjoying the room. In fact, we did do a good amount of hanging out there b/c the hotel is kind of far from the heart of the tourist action, which was a con. We'd go out during the day and be exhausted by 6pm, come back to the hotel to rest, but be too pooped to trek back out for dinner. Although the hotel is just a short walk to the Metro, the walk feels kind of long by the end of the day--especially since the other buildings surrounding the hotel are kind of run down. The hotel is off the main strip. Also, none of the tour books I used recommended any restaurants remotely close to our hotel, which was a bummer. In short, the room/hotel was really nice, and they provided very helpful and very friendly service. Ramon went above and beyond to help us settle in, and everyone at the front desk was nice. The location wasn't the best, and I think we missed out on some Barcelona action just because it was far from the heart of things and we ended up getting too tired to go back out after retreating to the hotel to rest early-evening. Great hotel, so-so location. P.S. The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Flamencospain
Reviews.Content: I was at the Vincci Arena this last weekend. It seems to be a little off the beaten track, but is really at a good location. You have one Metro station just a block away (Tarragona) and two more within a 5 Min. walk. Plaza España, as Metro Station, place of interest with access to Montjuic and shops and bars (for coffee and meals) right around the corner, this hotel is great. We were lucky on receiving a great price over Expedia. The room was large and tasteful decorated. The shower huge enough for more than one. The only downpoint were the noisy room doors. Each time a neighbour let his door close, the headpart of our bed was shaking and it even woke me up during the night. The springs to close those doors are a little tight :-). Internet access is very (!) expensive, but you can watch TV for free. Just for special movies you have to pay extra. There was a special offer on the breakfast buffet for the 2. Person 1/2 price, but we did not use it. Overall I would stay again if I would get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissyFi
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Hotel. friendly & helpful staff and funky interior design, just a great Boutique Hotel! My partner booked this hotel via Expedia for a special mini break. We had 3 nights room only, and on arrival we explained it was going to be a special weekend, and reception said they didnt realise - but would like to offer us an upgrade the following morning! The 1st room on 3rd floor was small but neat, however the upgrade to the 5th floor was lovely - large bright rooms, lots of storage space and the bathroom was huge - with a very large and deep bath of which we took full advantage of! The location is a little out of town, but not a problem as close to two Metro stations. The area was similar to London's east end - clearly up and coming. There was a little gym and an outside chilling area next to the resturant that has a funky design and some huge metal daffodils to brighten it up! The local area is safe and there are some great patisseries locally if you dont want the breakfast at the hotel. I will be sure to visit Vincci Arena when i return to Barcelona. One strange thing is that they dont have an Iron for you to use in the rooms - but thats the only down point!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and stylish. Likely too stylish as the lights they use turn the corridor into a sauna. The regular rooms are clean but small and unpractical. You can't even open a laptop on the pseudo desk. Internet access is available but not working in all the rooms. The front desk seems to forget your requests. Breakfast is good and the price OK (12EUR).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rino73
Reviews.Content: We spent in this hotel almost one week during our honeymoon. It is very close to one of the main squares of Barcelona and obviuosly very close to the subway. Easy to reach, it has a warm and friendly reception with guys able to speak fluently english language. The room is big and very clean, the furniture is almost new and services offered (tv, hair dryer, shower, light system, air conditioner etc..) work efficiently. Staff has been all along our stay very friendly and ready to solve only one issue that happened during our stay....the shower box stopped letting down water and immediately after my call to the reception someone came to solve the problem. Movies are expensive and in-room bar is prohibitive; internet connection is too much expensive. Unfortunately, there is no air conditioner in the common spaces except the reception: this was sometimes a little bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cttourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice for sightseeing and using public transportation. We traveled with two other couples and we were all very happy with the choice. Excellent transporation two and from the airport by bus. Location is within walking of the Spanish Village, Placa Espanya and good restaurants. Staff was very accomodating. Enjoyed breakfast one day we were there. Quality was very good but overpriced. i guess if you are business traveler you can expense the meal but cost was $30. for two.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: ARJACT
Reviews.Content: Our travel group stayed at Vincci for four days. As stated the hotel is clean and modern with some upscale touches. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are y large with all amenities. Staff members went out of their way to be helpful and help us avoid trhe usual tourist traps. One caution. The hotel is situated in a great location. But, there is construction in progress across the street. Avoid an outside room if you are not a sound sleeper. Street noise and construction begin around 6AM. Otherwise, this is a great hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: ondon75
Reviews.Content: They really disappointed me in this hotel. I had booked a "Superior Twin or Double and Free entrance Spa and Gym" with breakfast in advance through the Internet. When I arrived to the hotel, I found out that the payment for the room was already charged from the credit card and I asked whether I should pay the rest (cca 107 EUR for 7 breakfasts) in advance. I was told by the receptionist that it is not necessary since I could change my mind and not to take all the breakfasts. So I decided after the first breakfast on monday, since, in my opinion, the variety of the buffet was rather small for 15.80 EUR. What was my surprise when I was forced to pay full 107 EUR on check out even though I took only one breakfast! After my protests, the receptionist told me that I have to pay it because it was booked in advance, despite of what she told me on my arrival. Regarding the price, the other problem is the absence of free wi-fi at least in the lobby and very hot and dark corridors. Rooms are elegant, but not always in a perfect state (e.g. nonfunctional plug in a bathtub, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: travelmomH
Reviews.Content: The hotel was, as the other reviewers say, just as the pictures shown. Clean, modern, elegant, in a great location and the staff was great and helpful. They accomodated our request to have a crib in the room, and allowed us to keep milk in the kitchen fridge (there was a small one in the room but didn't seem to work) Barcelona tips: Don't miss the magic montjuic fountain near plaza Espa~na at night, its beautiful, and free!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - nice design and location”
Reviews.Author: Maria-touragent
Reviews.Content: We truly liked our stay at Vincci Arena, though we were there just for 1 night. Got the great price promotion and for the price we paid it was a perfect place. The only thing is that colours were a bit dark, to my opinion, and it was hot at the halls, but the rest was good. The staff was very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: deepc55
Reviews.Content: great little hotel hidden from the crowd, a great location near (5 minute walk) from Plaza Espana and the hop on hop off bus station and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, but ultimately ordinary”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: Ah, but I hear you say 'hang on Chris, there's so many positive reviews here, you must be wrong'. Well, not really.... The Vincci Arena is pretty good, it's colourful, modern and trendy. But apart from an excellent dinner service, there isn't much more to make it a top choice. The reception is a fridge of coldness - temperature aside, it's dark and moody, with a tiny reception desk and 2 ultra slow lifts. Rooms are average size, with cold wooden floors (but tidy), a 'balcony' door that hardly opens for ventilation, a small minibar, reasonable bathroom, small screen TV with English news channels, and a funky lighting system - but somehow it doesn't allow the bathroom light to be switched on individually. Odd. The module housing the TV looks like it's straight out of an Ibis, but somehow it's befitting to the rest of the decor in the room. The beds are very hard too, which meant 4 nights without a good sleep. The windows are double glazed, but the door that opens half a foot or so doesn't close well enough to offer good soundproofing. That said, it's not overly noisy outside. Outside your room your going to a) die of dehydration and b) probably fall over your luggage, as it's exceptionally hot and poorly lit. Whilst you may be distracted by the snazzy lit door numbers, I really don't think this was a smart move. One of the more noticable plus points (apart from the useful location) is the staff at the desk, who always acknowledge you when you pass, and they speak very good English. Something that doesn't happen often on my travels around Europe. For me, a funky place, but average.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and good location but poor service.”
Reviews.Author: cocochou
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, well located, just a couple of blocks from plaça Espanya. The room is quite pleasant but does not have all the amenities of a real 4 star hotel. The AC works well in the rooms but the hallways are very very hot. We could hear everything from the room next door. We could hear them cough and talk! The maid waited to clean our room at 5pm just when we wanted to relax and take a shower after a day of walking around. The breakfast buffet is delicious but very expensive. They had a very interesting discount when we stayed there and we paid half price, so it's probably best not to book the room with the breakfast. BUT, the price we found on laterooms.com was very good. We only paid $85 per night. It's a very good bargain if you are able to find a price this low. It's a very good location with good subway lines.

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury hotel, amazing price.”
Reviews.Author: TTGZ
Reviews.Content: I travelled for 3 nights in June 2009 with my girlfriend for a city break booked through Lastminute.com. Flights and hotel from London came to £169, which we thought was an absolute bargain. The hotel lives up to its 4* rating - with very clean rooms, luxurious & modern design throughout, air conditioning, cable TV, exceptional views over the Montjuic Park from our 6th floor room, and very polite & helpful staff. Mostly we travelled around Barcelona using the Placa d'Espanya metro stop which is just a block away, giving you access to pretty much anywhere around the city within 20 minutes. The location was therefore excellent. The only downside was a small construction site across the street from our room - but if you live in a city, you come to expect this on pretty much every block. We were also there over Saturday and Sunday, when there was no work going on. Even on the Monday and Tuesday, when construction work began, it was fairly quiet and certainly didn't disturb us at all. In summary: we couldn't have done the weekend to Barcelona any cheaper, even if we'd used Ryanair flights and stayed in hostels. This hotel made the trip well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff, very clean room and excellent breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyDoe2
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay with my girlfriend at the Vincci Hotel in Barcelona . I have booked it based on the reviews found on TripAdvisor and I have to say that I have found there exactly what others have said about this hotel here on the website. It was very clean, everything had taste and it was working properly, the room was large enough as well as the bath, the staff was very friendly and assisted us properly, the breakfast was very varied and excellent. The staff in the breakfast room was very helpful and polite as well and everything was spotless. The hotel is located approximately 5-10 minutes walk from the Sants train station and another 5 minutes walk to the Placa D'Espana, placing it in the middle of touristic attractions and making it easily accessible if you travel by train. The only down side of the hotel was that during the night the noise made outside could be heard in the room. However, it was not very loud and have enjoyed our time there. I recommend the hotel and we would definitely book it again when we go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern , convenient”
Reviews.Author: Arcee_CO
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise - a modern oasis on a quiet residential street. 2 short blocks to the Metro gives you "straight line" access to most key sites downtown for a one-dollar fare. The hotel was very cooperative in providing early AM check-in with no hassle, no extra charges. Our room (#212) was quiet with a great King bed, luxury bathroom. Free newspapers (all in Spanish), The room decor is trendy modern - dark wood, bold accent colors. Very nicely outfitted bathroom. If you have seen the Ian Schrager boutique hotels of NYC, this has a similar feel. One minor critique - the designer installed giant fluorescent light fixture to highlight the room numbers in 18" lettering. The odd hall lighting gives off heat so the halls are quite hot - although the rooms are very comfortable, as are lobby, elevators, dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: She25
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Barcelona, in a group of 6. I've stayed in various cheaper hostels around the city previously, but we wanted a nicer hotel for a bit of luxury. Rooms - all importantly, our king size bed (superior room) was an actual king size and not just two singles pushed together! Very comfortable, with air con and sound proofed rooms (although note that this doesn't cover any corridor noise and cleaners outside). Bathroom also very nice, would recommend taking your own hairdyer as the one supplied isn't very effective. Spa - free to use and there is a sauna, steam room, excersise bikes, treadmill and massage facilities. Definitely a good way to start the day. Reception were friendly and able to help with online checking in for the airport. Location - a block away from Plaza Espanya and parc Joan Miro. 2 stops on the underground to La Rambla and Plaza Catalunya. Near to the palace and Montjuic Park with cable cars, funiculars and beautiful landscaping. Plenty of little bars for coffee or menu del día around here, much cheaper and probably friendlier than in the centre. Rosat's was great with a small and friendly atmosphere. Recommendations - this is the first trip I've made it up to Montserrat - well worth the €22 ticket for a day's wandering in the mountain. Funicular railways, cable cars, various walks of varying ability. Montjuic park - great to wander round and see the Olympic stadium (free), and take a picnic! Plaza de Colón - halfway down the Rambla on the left, great to have a beer and tapas and watch the world go by. La Boquería - huge fresh produce market halfway down the Rambla on the right hand side. Take your camera! Just one word of caution - keep your hands firmly on your bag at all times as pickpockets are fairly rife. Other than this, a very safe and friendly city, the underground particularly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouGMidlands
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel with a bonus- sauna and steam room. Reviews about the coridoors being dark are true- but they are modern and moody and supposed to be like that- they're not dingy and pokey! Rooms nice and large, I'd liken to a Mal Maison, lots of dark velvet and rich colours. No kettle in the room and limited SKY channels but not a major problem. No restaurant in the hotel but a 5 min walk and you can be in the main centre with lots of choice. Staff very friendly and attentive. Good location 5 mins walk from underground but at night the local area itself can be daunting as it is a little off the beaten track. Had heard about mugging and pickpocketing in the city centre - don't let that put you off, just be sensible as you would in any other major city. Barcelona is fab!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff, Unimpressive Rooms”
Reviews.Author: abubnic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci Arena in early October for five days. The hotel is located near the Espanya Metro stop, the Bullfighting Ring and the Pillars of Parliament. We were also within walking distance of a fabulous dinner & Flamenco Show at Spanish Town. Things we liked: personable & helpful staff, hotel location central to the metro, bountiful breakfast, lots of storage space for personal items in the bathroom, lots of little stores, tapas bars and restaurants nearby. Things we didn't like: Eery green neon hallways, rock-hard bed (like sleeping on a box-spring!), dark purple out-of-scale furniture and decorations that made the room feel dark and oppressive, noisy garbage trucks at 3:30 am, boisterous people out on the streets at 5 am. We were traveling to three countries over five weeks. This was among our least favorite hotels. The location could not be beat, but we would probably look for a different hotel in the same vicinity if we were to stay in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “"Marvelona"”
Reviews.Author: nederick
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after having read the reviews about it, rating it as an excellent hotel. When we arrived there we were impressed at how modern and welcoming it was. Check in was very easy, we tried our hand at catalonian but the staff spoke excellent english. The rooms are the best hotel rooms i have ever stayed in. They have mood lighting, brilliantly decorating and to a very high standard. The hotel is very close to the magic fountain and to the main train station, barcelona sants, 5 minute walk. The closest metro station was tarragona and it took less than 10 minutes to get to the bottom of las ramblas. Metro is very cheap, a t-10 ticket will get you 10 tickets for 7euros. metro is very easy to and convenient to use. Hotel bar was reasonably priced, glass of wine €3. Mini bar in the rooms was even reasonably priced. We had breakfast at the restaurant and €16 was a lot to pay per person but the food was very good and you got a very good start to the day. I couldn't fault this hotel at all. Was fun to stay in, close enough to town, just what we wanted

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic but far from centre”
Reviews.Author: bunnyegg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vincci Arena for 3 nights in August 2008. The room was very clean, but the air conditioning was very cold and couldn't be turn down. The deco is stylish, and the reception was very helpful as well. We tried the massage in the hotel but was a waste of money, it felt like a rub more than a massage. The hotel is located near Espanya metro station, which is far from the main town centre (old town and La Rambla). Is not walkable distance, so must take public transport. I didn't feel it was value for money because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamed holidays”
Reviews.Author: vasilila
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a nice location among 3 metro stops,very close to placa Espanya,in a quite enough area.The rooms were perfect,although not very spacious,but impressive with very nice decoration.The bathroom was excellent. The staff is very polite and they speak english well.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arsenal7533
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and fairly new. Rooms, hallways, lobby are sportless, very modern, nicely furnished. Rooms are small but very quiet, clean and modern. Breakfast is overpriced. Staff is helpfull. Not the ideal location to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great, very modern”
Reviews.Author: gmfromnearlondon
Reviews.Content: We booked via LastMinuite.com and got a good deal on this 4 start hotel for 5 nights. We managed to obtain basicaly the same price as some of the 2-3 star places in the 'centre' of Barcelona. We were glad we did, since the Centre is really the tourist centre, and often loud into the night. This hotel's location was a big sell and we found it a huge plus. It is just seconds or a minutes walk from the nearest metro station and 2 minuits to Place De Spania, and so the Magic Fountains etc. Terrific! The hotel is not on a main road, and out window looked out to a side street so was quiet most of the time. The room was always cleaned very well every day. The shower was great. We had very efficient Air-Con, a TV which, for the english speakers, had CNN, CBS, BBC-World, and UK Sky News (you have to keep going up on the channels!). Also gernman MTV, lots of spanish TV, some French Channels etc. One problem with the room, it was not a double bed but two singles pushed together. The beds were very comfy however. There was lots of storage, a fridge/minibar and safe. My real issue was with the soap. I am sorry, this really annoyed me! One tiny bar of saop was not enough every day for two of us, it really was tiny, about 2 cm square and less than 1cm thick. One day we returned to find no soap at all! I had to go to reception and get more. Our price didn't include breakfast, and we asked how much this was. 16 euro pp!! I actualy laughed out loud when we established this was not even for the two of us. There are several nice cafe's near by. My tip, head stright out of the hotel down the slide road looking road, turn left towards Place De Spania, and there is a bakery on the left. Great coffee, sweet and savoury pastries. will stay here again for the right price. That said in 6 days we saw everything barcelona had to offer, so we won't be back too soon!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit strange...”
Reviews.Author: elv_lin
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet. Arrived at the hotel to find a large group checking in, we presumed the worst and thought it would be a while until we check in, however the dilligent management took our details and we were sorted out in no time. The hotel looks a little quirky and stylish on the inside so the first impressions were good. We went down for dinner only to find three of the many tables were made up, this was slighty disconcerting - was the hotel quiet? Were they not expecting to do much business... Anyway my food was bland and my partners was an over-priced and under-cooked chewy stake. We didn't bother having breakfast at the hotel as there were couple of decent cafes on the walk down to Placa Espanya where you can get a decent coffee and a pastry for a couple of Euros. We did order room service a couple of times - this menu was actually better than the restaurant menu! The food was alright, a little bland again, though for room service the price was reasonable. With regards to the room, at first glance it seemed very nice. The only real problems were a little wear and tear and the tv didn't work properly. I think the "Japanese Garden" is massively disappointing, it's some giant plastic flowers and some white stone... Hmm. Not much more to say, the price was okay, a little on the expensive side given the location and the lack of facilities. Next time I'll try and get a hotel closer the Place Catalunya (city centre) as most of the decent eateries are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: betty_tours
Reviews.Content: The airport bus (1 stop from the airport) dropped us close to the hotel (400m) from Placa d Espanya, situated on a very quiet back street but close to two metro stations (the best way to get around). Upon arrival we had to get the paperwork out to check that there had not been a mistake on the price as it far exceeded our expectations. We used a three day metro ticket to travel around, it was so easy, and the hotel gave us advice and a map. We were very close to the Magic Fountains, the tourist bus stops and Crue Coberta shopping street. The only negative was the lack of places to eat and drink but we did find an Asian restaurant with no English spoken and had a great buffet meal, better that we had in the port at a fraction of the price as it was where the locals ate, 50m from the hotel. The room was great with a large bed, a decent bathroom and a cheap mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Average Location”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, larger than your average European hotel room. The room was nicely decorated and had a modern feel. Bathrooms are especially spacious. Bright green lit up numbers guide you to your room from the dimly lit hallways, nice touch I thought. the beds aren't the most comfortable but they're definitley above average, same with the pillows. Our room was located on an inner courtyard so we didn't hear any noise what so ever. The location is not fantastic. It's not walking distance to anything a typical tourist would want to see, however a two block stroll will get you to a metro stop(Barcelona's metro is very user friendly and goes everywhere you would need to go). Overall I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff was friendly and helpful in our brief encounters.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkpants
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in April 08 and had the most amazing visit. We arrived at the hotel after a long walk (we had missed our stop on with the airport bus - it really is the first stop and if no one else moves don't panic!!) to be told that there was good news and bad news. The bad news was that the whole of Barcelona had experienced a water problem so our room wasn't ready but the good news was that we had been upgraded as the hotel was aware that we were on our honeymoon. Roman on the front desk was fantastic, he took our luggage to keep it safe and recommended a restaurant where we could get lunch and a beer whilst we waited for our room to be ready. He also talked us through a map of Barcelona pointing out places that would be worth a visit. After lunch we returned to the hotel and our luggage was already in our room so they gave us a key and we went up to 701. It was amazing, we had our own terrace with table, chairs and a jacuzzi. The hotel had also sent up Champagne on ice for us. The room was spacious, the terrace amazing and the bathroom out of this world. It was all spotless. All the staff at the hotel were so helpful during our stay. We had the breakfast on our last day before heading back to the airport and although slightly expensive there was a huge amount of choice. We also had a drink one night in the lounge and that, along with the mini bar, was very reasonable. If I ever went back to Barcelona I would stay at this hotel. The location out of town was nice as it meant you could get away from the hustle and bustle if you wanted to but the underground into Las Ramblas was so easy it wasn't an effort. The pick pocketing is bad, we were fortunate as we left unscathed, others weren't so lucky. Just make sure you don't put your wallet in an easily accessible pocket and hold onto your hand bag.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gatzbee
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! Found this hotel through expedia originally, then looked it up on google and discovered tripadvisor.com. Read the reviews, and ultimately chose it because they were positive and indicated that it was in a good location. And definitely met my expectations! Located minutes away from Plaza Espanya. Took the Aerobus to the hotel by getting off at the 1st stop, which is Plaza de Espanya. then found the hotel in no time. I originally went to aerobus's official website to check out a map of the region and easily found Consell de Cent on it, drew it out before I left for my flight, and then easily found it once I arrived. Check in was easy. Arrived at 11ish and check-in was at 2. So they kept our luggages for us in the office next to the check in counter, and we then went to walk around outside for a bit and get to know the area. Afterwards, we got back at like 1:30 and our bags were all up in our room already. We were on the 6th floor facing a street. No problems with noise at all. Pretty quiet neighborhood in my opinion. Rooms are nice. 2 twin beds pushed together though. Lighting and decor is lovely. Toiletries in bathroom. Room and bathroom cleaned every day. Must leave towels in bathtub to get new towels every day. Never any issues really. Watched CNN+, which is the spanish CNN every morning to check out the weather and news. There is a supermarket called (Hipermarket) a couple blocks away. Ask the front desk and they will tell you. Also, nearby, there is Cafe Nou, as others have reported, as well as a cheap internet cafe, where I also bought a 5euro phone card to call back to the US. There is the little store run by an Indian guy nearby as well. But can get more and cheaper if you get to the supermarket. Bought juice and stored it in the mini fridge in the hotel. Hotel is only a few stops away from all major tourist attactions by metro. It really is in the most ideal location. The Aerobus to get back to the airport is also very close to the part of Plaza de Espanya near the hotel. Essentially, it's at this little stop that is across from the Hotel de Catalunya (I think that's what it was... basically the big hotel right on the Plaza) just off the sidewalk and directly across from the metro stop. No need to cross many streets. You will see a sign at the bus stop that says Aerobus. Staff at hotel were great. They could speak English pretty well as well. I think I remember a blond haired man (Ramon?) and woman, who spoke English well and were pretty helpful. On the last night, I wanted some bath soap b/c the cleaning service didn't leave any and also another hand towel. The front desk told me it'd be up in my room immediately. And sure enough someone brought it up in a few minutes. Would definitely stay at this hotel again if I was in Barcelona. Actually wished that I could have explored the area around a bit more and enjoyed the hotel more, but was always out and about site-seeing. Oh, and yes there is a fitness room, but it only has 2 bikes and 1 treadmill. There are a sauna and steam room, as well as showers. Never used any of these facilities as I never had the time. But they were clean and nicely laid out. Overall great.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: vaishyv
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 25th birthday and loved it. Spanish hotels are known for their high standards and this hotel was no exception. Rooms were large and the bed very comfy. Hotel has lots of facilities such as a gym and spa where you can have a turkish bath. The area the hotel is based is quiet with a few restaurants hidden around the back streets. Local subway is 5 minutes away and hotel is 4 train stops to La Ramblas. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lougheskefan
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona last year with a group of mates and we stay at the vincci arena for 4 night. This is great hotel, very clean and rooms beautifully decorated. The staff were very friendly and i could,nt ask for more. Location very good and metro only round the corner. For value and quality this hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spiderman32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in on our Honeymoon after our cruise ended in Barcelona. Hotel was very clean, spacious, and the rooms were very modern. At first we thought this hotel was in a distant area when were first booked it but it turned out to be great. The metro/subway station was within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler. I am the type of traveler that is always concerned about a hotel's cleanliness and this hotel exceeded my expectations. I also look for convenient location and this hotel is a mile from Las Ramblas which is where the cafes and tourist area. Only 1 or 2 stops of the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place”
Reviews.Author: spaintripToronto
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 3 week holiday and we stayed at the Vincci Arena for 4 days. It was one of the better experiences we had. The front desk folks were great. Very accomodating and helpful. We asked for a "quiet room" and had absolutely no difficulty with external noise. Although it is true that you can hear people opening and closing their doors. The room was well designed and very clean. We loved the location. We were very close to the Olympic Site and the Miro Art Gallery. It's a 20min walk to Las Rambals. One of the cheapest and best Tapas places is just 2 blocks away, the hotel will direct you to this quaint little place (a couple of blocks from the main Train Station). Our favourite place to eat was the fish bar/kiosk in the BACK/Centre of the Market. Go early, everything starts to shut down around 3pm. The other great place is in the old town....CAL PEP. Utterly fantastic. Tips: If you're coming from the airport...take the bus directly across from the information centre in the airport...the bus is very inexpensive a few Euro's and get off at the first stop,,,Plaza Espania...the hotel is only 2 blocks away... it could not have been easier. Avoid taxis every time we took one it was a hassle...overcharging...taking us on unnecessary long routes etc. All the stuff people say about thefts and scams are true. We met several people who had been robbed, at the train station and on Las Rambalas. Also, on Las Rambalas there is a group of Russian scam artists...one guy has 3 containers with a ball under one container...the idea is that you are to guess which ball is under a particular container. If you guess right they give you money. The scam is that they have their friends pose as tourists are 'winning' alot of money. Then real tourist take a turn, they first win a few Euros and as the wager get higher ie $100 Euros then suddenly you lose and they all run away...with your money.

Reviews.Title: “Space age style”
Reviews.Author: AguilanTravellers
Reviews.Content: smart super styled hotel very ultra modern styling the corridors are like something from startrek. rooms are small by any standard and the lighting is an art form and you need a computer programming degree to operate it Bathroom is an ultra modern experiance pitty the sink plug had to be extracted by prising out but not a huge problem good for a fwe days and well located for the centre of the city

Reviews.Title: “NIce homepad to visit Barcelona but too noisy too sleep”
Reviews.Author: Steph_Jul
Reviews.Content: The Vincci Area has style, courtuous personnel, a decent breakfast buffet, and it is well located - there are three subway stations within 300 meters. It is also convenientely close to Plaza Espagna where you can be dropped off by the low cost airport bus and its rooms are priced competitively. That sums up the plus side of the equation. The negative side includes paper-thin walls (or at least poor sound insolation), rock-hard beds, and lukewarm showers. After three nights at the Vincci, we could count on our fingers the number of decent hours of sleep... Overall, despite its many qualities, it is difficult to recommend this hotel as it failed to provide us what a hotel should - a good night sleep and basic conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: barunkevin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was really great. The hotel is very clean and the staff were very helpful (Ana and Josep) and also spoke english..they also provided us with maps and visiting hours for the museums etc during our stay. The breakfast selection is huge and the food was great also. rooms are very tidy and clean and also very cosy and comfortable. would definetely stay at this hotel once again since it's very close to the metro were you could get the train and go wherever you want. So it was definetely a good choice we made. It's hotel website shows pictures of the hotel which look exactly like it does in real life.

Reviews.Title: “thieves at hotel vincci arena”
Reviews.Author: Alexey_L
Reviews.Content: Stealing of your property, lying, hiding and eventually neglecting the very fact of the property existence – are all the ‘nice things’ you will face in Hotel Vincci Arena. We came there for our honeymoon, and it was the worst hotel experience that we’ve ever had. We travel a lot on business – working for a big international company in Russia - and for vacations, and we’ve never met hotel crew that irresponsible and merely mean. We came to the hotel right from our wedding, therefore we had with us the glasses that were given to us as a gift by our parents. They were not cheap, of course, but not extremely expensive – we had our clothes and other things that cost more in the room - so we didn’t think of putting them in the safe. We were using them sometimes having a bit of wine – and enjoying our time. One day the glasses disappeared. We reported to the service desk, they said they will find them. For the whole day they were saying ‘we will let you know as soon as we have any news’. Of course, we were very upset – as this was our wedding gift. In the evening, they told us that their cleaning lady took the glasses (‘she thought they were ours’), put them on a cart and they disappeared. They told us they’ve been looking for them for the whole day, the manager came, the Principal came,etc. They told us the cleaning lady was fired and they will compensate for the glasses. We were saying that we would rather prefer them to find the glasses, but they made it clear to us that they will compensate as they can’t find the glasses. We called to our parents (who got very upset, of course) to learn the price and reported it to the service desk. The service desk lady said the sum was too big and she had to call the Principal. She called the Principal and told us it’s alright, the Principal will compensate if we provide the checks. We already were not so confident in the hotel trustworthiness, so we requested a written confirmation, but the service lady said ‘You should trust us. We will compensate’. Ok, the situation was [-], probably we shouldn’t have had the glasses around, but the Principal promised to compensate, so we felt at least a bit relieved. And so, we left for Russia, and here the whole mess started. We sent the checks to the hotel the same week – by fax – and emailed them. No response. We emailed again. No response. We called them. The service desk said they received everything, but there would be public holidays, so they would get back to us the following week. We asked them why they didn’t respond before the holidays – having plenty of time, but they failed to explain. A week later – nothing, we called to the hotel and ask for the manager. They asked who was calling and said manager was not available. It lasted for a couple of days. After that we sent a rather angry message to the manager, to which he eventually responded the following day. Mr. Ramon Alegret (beware!) wrote that he consulted their legal department, and is not going to compensate. He gave out all the [-] on that we had to keep the glasses in the safe. That ‘we would like also inform you that all the staff have been selected through hard programs and all of them have our confidence from the first moment that they are considerer our staff’ And he even wrote ‘we can not check if you have or not on the room a wedding glasses’. This was so appalling that we requested Mr. Ramon Alegret to provide us with the contact of the Principal – the one who actually did suggest compensation for the glasses – it was not our idea – we just wanted the glasses back. But of course, Mr. Ramon Alegret is keeping quiet. It would all have been OK if they mentioned all the [-] about legal department and the safety box when we were there. But they suggested themselves to compensate and promised to do so if we provided the checks. Does it mean that their properly-selected staff is properly-trained to lie to get rid of the customers whose property disappears in their ill-famous hotel? Probably, yes! The story is not finished, but it is clear that neither ourselves not the people we know throughout the world will ever stay in the Vincci Hotels. We urge you not to do so, either, if you want to support us – and all other people who might have suffered from this chain – against corporative thiefs and liars.
