Or – to put it simple – to have your property safe and your mind calm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in easy commutable distance from city centre”
Reviews.Author: theycallmeuma
Reviews.Content: Great contemporary hotel with stunning rooms, bathroom and onsite gym, steam room and sauna! Staff service was good, and quick. Dining isn't worth the expense when you can get the food in central Barcelona, which is easily commutable from the 3minutes walk from Tarragona metro station. Not much surrounding the area, but would definitely stay again due to location and great transport links surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmoncymru
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and modern,the staff were very friendly and it is in a good position near placa da Englais,the Tourist bus stops at the end of the street making it ideal for touring. Only downside is the breakfast wasn't very good,we found better and cheaper by walking to the Placa and using a cafe there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shuvles77
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel with very friendly and helpful staff.The pictures and reviews I read before travelling were all excellent and the reality didn't disappoint. Conveniently located and excellent value for money. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and nice”
Reviews.Author: bhrsrk
Reviews.Content: Great modern hotel, with fairly good access to public transportation. The rooms including bathrooms are excellent, and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_The_World2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Vincci for 5 days on our recent trip. We were a little anxious about how this hotel would turn out to be - and were so pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The building is a new, modern construction with a classy lobby. The receptionist speaks English and was very helpful. The room itself was very tastefully decorated. The bathroom (very important) was really clean, well designed and inviting. This hotel is very close to the Ramblas - a 5 min ride by Metro. And the Metro station itself is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Very safe to walk around at night. It was a throughly enjoyable stay, and we'd definitely go back the next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Vincci Arena”
Reviews.Author: DianneEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Vincci Arena Barcelona. (7th - 11th October 2007). All in all we have nothing but good reports for this hotel. Its very modern, good sized rooms overall. We were located on the 6th floor directly opposite the elevator which we thought might have created lots of noise but quite the opposite...very peaceful. We had a double room which was really two single beds joined together but it was ok. The only complaint we had was the heating in the rooms. Without the air conditioning on we were nearly roasted alive as the windows wouldn't open. However with the air conditioning on it was way too cold. Wardrobe space etc was good, TV only had one English speaking channel. This wasn't a huge concern to us as we were not spending lots of time in the hotel. Breakfast is available from 7am till 10.30 am and is 15 euros per person. We didnt have breakfast in the hotel during our stay as to be honest you can get brekkie for far cheaper in any of the small cafes near to the hotel. The hotel itself is located near to Place Espagna where you can catch the Tourist Bus around Barcelona and also the underground. We had a 2 day tourist pass which was great as you can hop on and hop off the bus wherever you like on any of the 2 routes available. Only down side to this is that these buses get very busy and you have to queue at each of the attractions to get back on the bus....this can take quite a while at peak times. For us the location of the hotel was fine however I can understand that some people may find it a bit out of the way. Maybe about 15 minutes to Las Ramblas. Its sometimes nice to see other areas and there were nice little markets on at night near the hotel so it was nice to see other goings on other than in the "tourist zone". Plenty little supermarket shops nearby too if you want to stock up on water, juices etc. All in all a really nice stay at this hotel, would definitely come here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Vincci Arena
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Consell de Cent 51-53 | (esq. C/ Béjar), 08014 Barcelona, Spain
